Identify given values: mass of rod 1 kg, length of rod 1 m, magnetic induction intensity 1 T, tension when not energized 4 N.
Initial tension is equal to the weight of the rod, T = mg = 10 N.
New tension when rod is energized is 1/4 of initial tension, T' = 2.5 N.
Using tension equation T = BLI, substitute values to get 2.5 = 1 x 1 x I.
